intro: Scrophularia lasiocaulis, commonly known as the woolly scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of tubular, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Scrophularia lasiocaulis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
